meanings.definition: The state or quality of being junior.
meanings.sent1: In our school play, the juniorities were excited to have important roles.
meanings.sent2: The juniorities in the company often have to prove themselves before getting promoted.
meanings.sent3: The juniorities decided to form a club to support each other in their new roles.
meanings.sent4: The juniorities in the team were like fresh buds waiting to bloom into experienced players.
meanings.sent5: The juniorities' enthusiasm and energy brought a new dynamic to the group.

meanings.definition: The group of individuals who are younger or of lower rank.
meanings.sent1: The juniorities at the party were having fun playing games together.
meanings.sent2: In the office, the juniorities often seek guidance from more experienced colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The senior members jokingly called the juniorities the 'young and restless' group.
meanings.sent4: The juniorities in the class were like eager puppies, always ready to learn new things.
meanings.sent5: The juniorities brought a fresh perspective and innovative ideas to the team.
